name: Chris's Fast As Shit
description: This is for Chris to LEARN

name: Fast 'n BN
description: Fast advance, les cards in the deck, more chances to get and score agendas. Lot of ice to protect remote, r&d and HQ.

name: [Beta] Recycle, steal and escape
description: The main idea : use the escape bonus to avoid traces. I try to add some things and i think exile can be a good identity for a deck based on escape. This deck is still in beta, do you have some ideas ?

name: [Beta v0.1] Recycle, steal and escape
description: The main idea : use the escape bonus to avoid traces. I try to add some things and i think exile can be a good identity for a deck based on escape. This deck is still in beta, do you have some ideas ?

name: Burn Notice
description: Rnd Pressure medium digs, focus on rnd keep ice down or dead

name: ...Cause the Garbage Man Can!!!
esKApTE
description: Like my exile escape deck, i'll focus on escape to avoid trace. Can be nice with Kate.

name: Minefield
description:
Originally a NEXT deck, but trying it out as an ice-heavy core HB for an economical boost.

The deck was built around in an initial interest in Minelayer, which allows piggybacking on Runner clicks to build impressive low-cost servers quickly. To support this archetype, I have added in Howlers and Awakening Centers. ABT and Haas' Pet likewise benefit from the high ice density. Influence was spent on some good out-of-faction ice: Archer, Caduceus and Tollbooth. A single Watanabe (I only have one core) was also bought for financial support, I think he will pay off, especially if coupled with a Minelayer. A corporate Troubleshooter and a sprinkling of traps make for some additional surprises.

name: Rush the NEXT Design !
description: 25 Ices, 17 low cost (3 max) with EtR to make sure you stop the runner. Some high cost ices that can be rezzed through BER or Howler to rush agendas by the turn 2-3. Money generated with operation, MMC or Gila. Shipment from SanSan to help secure the scoring. When you ABT, considering defending archives if you didn't already because no Jackson (can't get 3 of for influence sake, so better have none)

name: It's expensive to run! - V 2.0 - Revised
description: -2 Data Hounds -1 Datapike -1 Pop-up Window -1 Data Raven + 2 Bastion +2 TMI +2 Wall of Static +3 Invasion of Privacy

name: Gabe vHJ.2.2
description: I finally got ahold of a full art Gabe so I'm finally running criminal. My local meta is crim lite (heavy shaper and anarch) so I'm feeling like crim offers a play style locals are less familiar with. I went big rig with a full set of fairie for early (and even late) runs, clone chip for retrieving key programs (Gordian blade especially) if necessary, HQ access for cerebral imaging matchups, hostage and the three connections because of course. Otherwise, standard full event suite for crim.

name: Kate contacts vHJ2.0
description: Underworld contacts and PC for economy. Rabbit holes and DMC for MU and link. I've decided to try this concept again and see if I can get it to work. 3 hostage because you MUST get all 3 UWC out. I've decided to run without Data suckers for a while and just go economy and efficient breakers.

name: Psycho Gods vHJ1.0
description: This is my slight modifications to the excellent Psycho Gods build. Ghost branch was 1-4 in the games I played so I felt a TMI was a better option for the influence. Archived memories was also 1-4 and I constantly wished I had another card Instead. Rototurret is fine as a 2 off rather than 3 IMO, I went with a Heimdall 1.0 and a Viktor 2.0 as replacements. I played assets naked and runners would run and trash them. Trashing before or after I rez is fine with me, if they trash after rez it's usually a wash in tempo between us. I had a LOT more success just building a one ICE server and putting them in there. It puts more pressure on the runner to find a way in and moves tempo your way. That's why I upped the ICE to 17. I'd like to get a couple more but I'll see how this works for now.

name: HB - Guard V2
G Thang V2
Rielle + Wyrm
Psycho Gods vHJ1.5
description: I forgot to update the agendas. While I did get a PSF/EFF committee win in one game, I could have won with agenda advance at that point. With 12(!) assets you can easily tire the runner of running remotes with unadvanced cards, letting you install a 3/2 and score next turn. Is that an asset I'll have to beggar myself to get to and trash or an agenda? Better run R&D this turn is what you want the runner constantly thinking. 3/2 agendas also mean lower tags (2-3) can still be a FA option with psychographics. With Jackson Howard I feel comfortable running and triggering ABT, another reason I upped the ICE.

name: Jinteki Invasion
description: A rich jinteki deck with IoP for major disruption options, even a possible IoP/Neural emp win. A couple odd ice to surprise runners. Himitsu Baku may be an interesting pair with chum, chum the HimBa and return it to your hand after they encounter it and watch them take the damage. I need to reread the timing rules to see if this is legal though.

name: The Experiential Jazz Professor v4
description: I think this is the final version of this deck until we get some new cards, as I am really happy with how it plays now. I've removed 3x Diesel because Prof Contacts is really the draw/economy engine in this deck. I've also switched Armitage for Daily Casts to better synergize with using your clicks to hit it. Prof Contacts is so important for this deck that I recommend taking the mulligan to try to get it in your opening hand. That said Kati, Daily Casts, Sahasrara, and/or Scheherazade can keep you functioning without it and I feel it is consistent enough not to need Diesel as a backup plan. Two cards you want to install early are Sahasrara and Djinn. I like to Test Run Sahasrara, use its credits to install Djinn, and then install Sahasrara back on Djinn the next turn... but I definitely find it worth it to use SMC to bring out Sahasrara as you will make back that 4 credits in no time... and while you can't use Sahasrara to pay the SMC trash cost those 2 creds can be the difference between being able to bring out and use a breaker mid run or not.  Once you've got your rig set up Scavenge it for a Parasite or whatever. Scheherazade can be a bit risky (especially once Mala Tempora is out) but it's a great place to Test Run onto or put SMC, Faerie, Deus X, Crecentus, Imp, or anything else temporary (or that losing won't lose you the game) - those credits add up. Otherwise it plays like any Anarch Shaper with fixed strength breakers and Datasuckers to make running as cheap as possible since the Prof ain't rich.  Getting out a Morning Star-asaurus (What are these "barriers" you speak of?!) or Femme with a Test Run->Scavenge combo is super fun but don't hoard those cards in your hand trying to make it happen. The first cards to me on the chopping block for changes are probably Crescentus (awesome but situational) and Scheherazade (great money but a little scary) or Plascrete if you don't play against Tag and Bag. Suggestions welcome!

name: Frostbite 1.0
description:
This deck focuses heavily on advancing ice, assets, and agendas through several different means in order to simultaneously build up defenses and score agendas. All the ice in this deck are advance-able and serve not only as protection but as forms of economy as well as methods to score agendas with. The idea is to set up your ice, preferably covering your bases at first, and advancing them whenever possible using the identity ability, operation cards, and clicks when capable. By compounding several advancement counters on different pieces of ice (and potentially the assets they're protecting) you can use cards like Trick of Light and Shipment from Kaguya and SanSan to move these advancements towards agendas and assets to score quickly at crucial points in the game. This can allow the Corp to take control of the pace of the game somewhat and throw the Runner through a loop with things like Ghost Branch which makes them think twice about running servers remote recklessly.

This deck of course requires a good amount of economy in order to advance all it's ice, assets, and ultimately agendas. This is accomplished through cards like Hedge Fund, Commercialization, Beanstalk, and even the agendas once they've been scored. With a steady flow of credits you can advance as much as possible which enables you to build up your walls of defense and trim off of them when you need to in order to score agendas/assets. The trick to making this deck work is monitoring the levels of advancements on your ice and making sure you have enough on them to trim off if you need them while still being strong enough to hold off run attempts on crucial servers. Once they're strong enough to trim off of you can install agendas and score them more quickly with the Op cards. Then once you've run short of Op cards Jackson Howard can bring them back into your deck to be reused.

Any and all advice and suggestions are welcome, thanks!

name: HB SanSan FA
description: This is a pretty standard fast advance/rush deck. The difference here is made by shipment from sansan and restructure. These allow you to operate on a relatively low economy when you need to (5 cred advance out of hand with shipment and biotic), or sustain a high economy so bioticlabor and ssc grid won't bankrupt you, allowing you to afford rezzing ice the turn after you fa.

name: Chaos Attack 2.0
description: An R&D killer

name: Kate contacts vHJ2.1
description: I dropped stimhack for a crescentus. My ability to recurse makes it a reusable e:shutdown. I also have a disrupter and lemuria codecracker I could slot in its place.

name: NBN  Funny to play
description:
Snare, Aggre. S, etc.. Using archieved memory and jackson for strategical move Chilo city grid and trace ice to give multiple tags

It's funny to play~!!
